meanings.definition: The outermost layer of the pericarp of a fruit.
meanings.sent1: The exocarp of the apple is shiny and smooth.
meanings.sent2: When you peel an orange, you remove the exocarp.
meanings.sent3: The exocarp of the peach decided to wear sunglasses to protect itself from the sun.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like the delicate touch of an exocarp, revealing the hidden sweetness within.
meanings.sent5: The exocarp of the watermelon was so vibrant, it seemed to glow in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: The skin or rind of a fruit.
meanings.sent1: She carefully removed the exocarp of the banana before eating it.
meanings.sent2: The exocarp of the lemon is often used in cooking to add flavor.
meanings.sent3: The exocarp of the grapefruit told a joke, making everyone burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: His words were like the bitter taste of an exocarp, masking the true sweetness underneath.
meanings.sent5: The exocarp of the kiwi was fuzzy to the touch, surprising those who expected smooth skin.
